meanings.definition: To bear fruit or become fruitful.
meanings.sent1: The apple tree will fructify in the spring, producing juicy fruits.
meanings.sent2: With proper care, the garden will fructify and yield a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The farmer's magical potion made the barren land fructify overnight!
meanings.sent4: Her hard work and dedication fructified into a successful business venture.
meanings.sent5: The rain came just in time to fructify the parched crops, saving the harvest.

meanings.sent1: Regular exercise can fructify your efforts to lead a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The new irrigation system will fructify the once barren fields, turning them into fertile land.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's groundbreaking research fructified the field of medicine.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude and hard work fructified her career aspirations.
meanings.sent5: The investment in education will fructify into a brighter future for the students.
